titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: The papers carry the fateful tidings that Great Britain declared war against Germany in defence of the independence of Belgium

. We decided to return home at once so as to be on the spot in case of any emergency. We travelled by way of Carlisle, and reached Durham about 3 p.m.: the stations swarmed with Territorials & Reservists in the process of being mobilized.
The Germans have declared war against Belgium, & are threatening an invasion of Holland!
